thread.title: Gina Miller launches new campaign for vote which could BLOCK Brexit
thread.title_full: Gina Miller launches new campaign for vote which could BLOCK Brexit

title: Gina Miller launches new campaign for vote which could BLOCK Brexit
text:
In the face of no opposition, whoever feels the need to be the voice of reason needs to speak up now. Currently MPs are too weak to do that Gina Miller 
Campaign2018’s open letter signed by Ms Miller and MPs including Nick Clegg and David Lammy, says: “The Government has promised to deliver “a good deal for Britain” in negotiating Brexit. 
“This outcome is by no means guaranteed. Although a vote has now been promised to Parliament on the emerging settlement of the negotiations, the government is only offering a choice between a deal that may prove unsatisfactory as a means of safeguarding our country's future, or withdrawal from the EU with no agreed relationship at all. GETTY The 51-year-old is demanding politicians have a full vote on Brexit negotiations 
“A patriotic approach to the Brexit process would surely keep all options open in the national interest. We believe Parliament should amend the Article 50 notification Bill to ensure that it can determine what should be done if negotiations break down. 
“Parliament's vote on any emerging settlement must also permit, if the terms are not in the national interest, amendment or extension of the negotiations, and to allow the country the option of an alternative relationship with the EU , including the possibility of membership.” 
The site has more than 7,000 supporters since Monday and comes Ms Miller branded MPs “weak” after the House of Commons voted the bill through unamended with a large majority of 372. PA Tory grandee Lord Heseltine has vowed to rebel against Theresa May over Brexit PA The House of Commons voted the Brexit Bill through unamended with a large majority of 372 
Ms Miller said: “In the face of no opposition, whoever feels the need to be the voice of reason needs to speak up now. 
“Currently MPs are too weak to do that — so we must do it for them. If it doesn’t work, then we will try again with the Great Repeal Bill or try and get emergency legislation.” 
Tory grandee Lord Heseltine has vowed to rebel against Theresa May over Brexit and back opposition efforts in the House of Lords to ensure a meaningful vote on the final outcome of exit negotiations. 
He said Labour, Liberal Democrat and rebellious Tory colleagues ready to back a change to the Brexit Bill simply want to uphold the Supreme Court's ruling that MPs and peers have ultimate authority. What Theresa May's 12-point Brexit plan really means Mon, January 16, 2017
